dubtrack-bot.title: DUBTRACK-BOT
dubtrack-bot.description2:
A BOT for Dubtrack I'm working on. Right now it is working on the [NB3 Room](https://www.dubtrack.fm/join/nightblue3).
Go say hi to him with "!sayhi netuxbot" !

info-items.name: Bookmark
info-items.text: Dubtrack Youtube Playlist Importer (Drag to your bookmarks)

info-items.name: How to enable
info-items.text: Click on the bookmark once you're in Dubtrack.

info-items.name: How to import from public playlist
text2: Go to Dubtrack, open the browser console pressing F12. If you're not on the "console" tab then go there.
Copy and paste to console: [[YTImporter.import('{name of youtube account that owns the playlist}', '{name of playlist in youtube}', '{name of playlist in dubtrack}');]]
Replace the stuff inside curly brackets with what it tells you to (also remove the curly brackets).
text: Go to Dubtrack, open the browser console pressing F12. If you're not on the "console" tab then go there.
Copy and paste to console: YTImporter.import('{name of youtube account that owns the playlist}', '{name of playlist in youtube}', '{name of playlist in dubtrack}');
Replace the stuff inside curly brackets with what it tells you to (also remove the curly brackets).

info-items.name: How to import from private playlist
text2: Get the playlist url, it should look like this: [[https://youtube.com/playlist?list={a bunch of characters}]]
Copy the "bunch of characters". Thats the Playlist ID and it will be helpful later.
Go to Dubtrack, open the browser console pressing F12. If you're not on the "console" tab then go there.
Copy and paste to console: [[YTImporter.importFromPlaylistId('{id of playlist in youtube}', '{name of playlist in dubtrack}');]]
Replace the stuff in curly brackets that says "{id of playlist in youtube}" with the Playlist ID you copied before.
Replace the stuff inside curly brackets with what it tells you to (also remove the curly brackets).
text: Get the playlist url, it should look like this: https://youtube.com/playlist?list={a bunch of characters}
Copy the "bunch of characters". Thats the Playlist ID and it will be helpful later.
Go to Dubtrack, open the browser console pressing F12. If you're not on the "console" tab then go there.
Copy and paste to console: YTImporter.importFromPlaylistId('{id of playlist in youtube}', '{name of playlist in dubtrack}');
Replace the stuff in curly brackets that says "{id of playlist in youtube}" with the Playlist ID you copied before.
Replace the stuff inside curly brackets with what it tells you to (also remove the curly brackets).
